title: Finance Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A fintech benchmarks emphasize sustainable economics and operational scalability alongside growth. Investors compare your efficiency metrics against both fintech peers and traditional financial services. These benchmarks demonstrate business maturity beyond user acquisition. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Annual Revenue
metrics.note: Annualized revenue from all sources. Quality matters—high retention, expanding customers preferred.

metrics.label: Revenue Growth Rate
metrics.note: Annual growth rate. Efficient growth valued over hyper-growth with poor economics.

metrics.label: Monthly Active Users
metrics.note: Active engaged users. Quality of engagement matters—transacting users more valuable than passive.

metrics.label: LTV:CAC Ratio
metrics.note: Based on mature cohorts. Should show improvement and path to 5:1+.

metrics.label: CAC Payback Period
metrics.note: Time to recover CAC. Trending toward sub-12 months at scale.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention
metrics.note: Revenue retention including expansion. Shows deepening customer relationships.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: At scale gross margin. Should show improvement trajectory toward target.

metrics.label: Monthly Transaction Volume
metrics.note: Transaction volume showing financial services scale.

metrics.label: Loss Rate
metrics.note: Combined fraud and credit losses. Should compare favorably to industry benchmarks.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Scaled team with depth in product, engineering, compliance, and operations.
